item.title: Duterte’s Fans Rally in The Hague as the I.C.C. Weighs Evidence Against Him
item.description: The protests are a sign of the Philippine ex-leader’s ongoing influence, even as he faces a possible trial for the deaths of thousands during his war on drugs.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Regalado
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:credit: Ilvy Njiokiktjien for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Supporters of Rodrigo Duterte, the former leader of the Philippines, on Saturday outside the International Criminal Court detention center on the outskirts of The Hague.

item.title: Consejos para almacenar frutas y verduras de la mejor manera
item.description: Los buenos productos agrícolas son un regalo. Manténlos frescos el mayor tiempo posible con estos consejos.
item.dc:creator: Kristen Miglore, Andrew Bui and Barrett Washburne

media:content.media:description: Aprender a conservar tus frutas y verduras de la forma correcta puede ayudarte a ahorrar dinero y reducir el desperdicio de alimentos.

item.title: No, Trump Isn’t Good for Putin
item.description: Russian hopes for respect have been dashed.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Notte

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times

item.title: The ‘Scrubs’ Reboot, Plus 6 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The medical comedy is back for another run, and the 50th season of “Survivor” is set to begin.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:credit: Jeff Weddell/Disney
media:content.media:description: Donald Faison, left, and Zach Braff in “Scrubs.”

item.title: 12 atuendos inolvidables en los BAFTA
item.description: Trajes vaporosos, faldas de sirena, pies de zorrillo y mucho más.

item.title: Tour Montparnasse is One of Paris’s Uglier Landmarks. It’s Getting a Makeover.
item.description: The Tour Montparnasse is one of Paris’s least-loved landmarks. After half a century, it’s finally being remodeled.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler, Ségolène Le Stradic and Dmitry Kostyukov

media:content.media:credit: Dmitry Kostyukov for The New York Times

item.title: No Corrections: Feb. 23, 2026
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Feb. 23, 2026.

item.title: Quote of the Day: These Black Medics Drove a Revolution In Emergency Care
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, February 23, 2026.

item.title: Lo que hay que saber sobre la muerte de ‘El Mencho’
item.description: El gobierno mexicano dijo el domingo que había matado a Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, líder histórico de una de las organizaciones criminales más poderosas del país, el Cártel Jalisco Nueva Generación.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni

media:content.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Graffiti pintado por el Cártel Jalisco Nueva Generación en una casa de El Aguaje, México, en 2022

media:content.media:credit: Nate Schweber for The New York Times

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 1 Finale Recap: On the Road Again
item.description: A melancholy finale sees Dunk finally treated as a proper knight, which includes a royal request to take on Egg as his proper squire.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)

media:content.media:credit: Steffan Hill/HBO
media:content.media:description: Egg (Dexter Sol Ansell) still wants to stay with Dunk, but Dunk says he is “done with princes.”

item.title: Susan Sheehan, Pulitzer-Winning Chronicler of Lives on the Margins, Dies at 88
item.description: As a journalist and author, she wrote meticulous portraits of people for The New Yorker. Her book “Is There No Place on Earth for Me?” won the Pulitzer Prize.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel
item.category: Is There No Place on Earth for Me? (Book)

media:content.media:credit: George Tames/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Susan Sheehan in 1982 at her home in Washington.

item.title: What to Know About the Killing of ‘El Mencho’
item.description: The Mexican government has killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the longtime leader of one of Mexico’s most powerful gangs, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni

media:content.media:credit: Ulises Ruiz/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Firefighters extinguishing a burning bus in Jalisco state, Mexico, on Sunday. Organized crime groups set fire to buildings and vehicles across the country in response to the death of Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes.

item.title: Armed Man Is Shot and Killed at Mar-a-Lago, Authorities Say
item.description: Officers fatally shot Austin Tucker Martin, 21, after he entered a secure perimeter at Mar-a-Lago, officials said. The authorities said he was carrying what appeared to be a shotgun and a fuel canister.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Silva

media:content.media:credit: Saul Martinez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: An armed man was shot and killed at Mar-a-Lago, President Trump’s resort in Palm Beach, Fla., on Sunday, according to local and federal authorities.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers: February 23, 2026
item.description: Hannah Binney returns with another Monday puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Natan Last

media:content.media:credit: Chip Litherland for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: What goes up must come down. Then back up after intermission.

item.title: Ethan Slater Stars as the Mime Marcel Marceau in ‘Marcel on the Train’
item.description: This bio play about Marcel Marceau, which delves into his part in the French Resistance, stars Ethan Slater (yes, that’s Boq from the “Wicked” movies).
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Vincentelli

media:content.media:credit: Sara Krulwich/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ethan Slater in “Marcel on the Train” at the Classic Stage Company in Manhattan.

item.title: Willie Colón Played Up the Bad Guy With Purpose
item.description: By styling himself after mobsters and blaxploitation characters early in his career, Mr. Colón, the legend of salsa music who died on Saturday, crafted an everlasting image.
item.dc:creator: Sandra E. Garcia

media:content.media:credit: Globe Photos/ZUMA Press Wire, via Shutterstock
media:content.media:description: Willie Colón was a salve for the Latino youth of the 1960s. He became an avatar for young Latinos who could not style themselves after John Wayne, Muhammad Ali or Elvis Presley.

item.title: Here Are the Rare Instances of Fatal Shootings by the Secret Service
item.description: Sunday’s shooting of an armed man at President Trump’s Florida club is one of only a handful of fatal encounters that the agency has had in its 160-year history.
item.dc:creator: Eileen Sullivan

media:content.media:credit: Tom Brenner for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Secret Service is charged with protecting the president and other top government officials.

item.title: New York City Faces Its Second Big Storm in Weeks
item.description: The storm in late January was bad enough. This one is bringing true blizzard conditions, and the city has stepped up its response.
item.dc:creator: Mihir Zaveri

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani of New York described the city’s plans for the winter storm at a news conference on Sunday.

item.title: Remains Believed to Be St. Francis’ Are on Rare Public Display
item.description: The bones of St. Francis, preserved in a nitrogen-filled plexiglass case, were shown to the public just once, briefly, in 1978.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:credit: Gregorio Borgia/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Believers lined up to see the bones of St. Francis at the basilica bearing his name in Assisi, Italy, on Sunday.

item.title: F.B.I. Director Celebrates Olympic Hockey Victory on Day of Mar-a-Lago Shooting
item.description: Kash Patel’s trip to Italy came at a fraught and frenetic time for the bureau and Mr. Patel, who has shown little willingness to curb his jet-setting.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer, Glenn Thrush, Motoko Rich and Tariq Panja

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Kash Patel, the F.B.I. director, watched the final men’s hockey match between the United States and Canada on Sunday from an arena box in Milan.

item.title: Norman Francis, Who Led Xavier University Into a New Era, Dies at 94
item.description: He was America’s longest-serving college president, with 47 years of service, by the time he retired in 2015.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter

media:content.media:credit: Bill Haber/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Norman Francis in 2008. He accepted the position of president of Xavier University on the day the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in 1968.

item.title: Armed Man Shot Dead at Mar-a-Lago by Trump’s Secret Service Was a 21-Year-Old From N.C.
item.description: The 21-year-old man, from North Carolina, was killed by law enforcement officers after he entered secure perimeter of Mar-a-Lago.
item.dc:creator: Sonia A. Rao and Christina Morales

media:content.media:credit: Marco Bello/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Mar-a-Lago after U.S. Secret Service and local police shot and killed Austin Tucker Martin, a 21-year-old man who breached the perimeter armed with a shotgun.

item.title: Trump Considers Targeted Strike Against Iran, Followed by Larger Attack
item.description: The top negotiators plan to meet in Geneva on Thursday for last-ditch talks, debating a new proposal that could create an off-ramp as two carrier groups massed within striking distance of Iran.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes, David E. Sanger, Tyler Pager and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump’s threat is the latest example of how he is trying to force Iranian leaders to see that they have no choice but to give up every aspect of their nuclear program.

item.title: Courting China Again
item.description: The German chancellor will travel to Beijing this week, the latest high-level visitor as Western countries pivot back to China.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: Pool photo by Kin Cheung
media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain in Shanghai last month.

item.title: Un hombre armado es abatido en Mar-a-Lago, según el Servicio Secreto
item.description: El sheriff local identificó al hombre como Austin Tucker Martin, de 21 años y originario de Cameron, Carolina del Norte. El presidente no se encontraba en su complejo de Florida y no ha hecho comentarios sobre el tiroteo.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim, Sonia A. Rao and Tyler Pager

media:content.media:credit: Saul Martinez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un hombre armado fue abatido en Mar-a-Lago, el complejo del presidente Trump en Palm Beach, Florida, el domingo, según las autoridades locales y federales.

item.title: Fans Pack Bars as U.S.-Canada Hockey Game Puts Rivalry on the Line
item.description: Canadians and Americans jammed bars that opened early on Sunday to watch the United States deal the Canadian team, and the country, a devastating blow in overtime.
item.dc:creator: Shawna Richer and Rylee Kirk

media:content.media:credit: Brendan George Ko for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: At the Pilot, one of Toronto’s oldest bars, more than 300 people, most wearing red, jammed onto two floors starting at 7:30 in the morning to watch Canada play on big screens.

item.title: 2026 BAFTAs Winners: ‘One Battle After Another’ Wins Best Film, Besting ‘Sinners’
item.description: Paul Thomas Anderson’s comedy drama won six awards at the British equivalent of the Oscars. The best actor choice, however, was a surprise.
item.dc:creator: Alex Marshall
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television

media:content.media:credit: Getty Images for BAFTA
media:content.media:description: Paul Thomas Anderson accepts the best director award for “One Battle After Another” during the EE BAFTA Film Awards at London’s Royal Festival Hall on Feb. 22.

item.title: Un espectáculo en el Centro Kennedy se cancela por la contaminación intencional de la pista de hielo
item.description: No se ha producido ninguna detención después de que un individuo vertiera un líquido desconocido en una pista de patinaje temporal.
item.dc:creator: Michaela Towfighi
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:credit: Caroline Gutman para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: La compañía canadiense de patinaje artístico Le Patin Libre actuando en el Centro John F. Kennedy para las Artes Escénicas este mes.

item.title: Hunter College to Review Professor’s ‘Abhorrent’ Remarks at Meeting
item.description: A student objected to the potential closure of her New York City middle school. The professor, speaking on a hot mic, said, “They’re too dumb to know they’re in a bad school.” The comment was assailed as racist.
item.dc:creator: Troy Closson

media:content.media:credit: Drew Angerer/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A professor at Hunter College made offensive remarks during a meeting she was attending virtually. The college said that it expects members of its community to abide by the “institutional identity, values and policies.”

item.title: Trump Calls on Netflix to Oust Susan Rice From Its Board
item.description: The president made the attack as Netflix and Paramount Skydance face a key deadline in a bidding war for Warner Bros. Discovery.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hirsch

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Susan Rice, who worked in the Clinton, Biden and Obama administrations, joined the Netflix board in 2018, left in 2020 to work in the Biden administration, and then joined again in 2023.

item.title: La TSA dice que el programa PreCheck seguirá operativo en los aeropuertos
item.description: El Departamento de Seguridad Nacional dijo el domingo que el programa de seguridad aeroportuaria seguiría disponible, horas después de anunciar que sería suspendido.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo and Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Pasajeros en el Aeropuerto Internacional O’Hare de Chicago el año pasado.

item.title: When Faced With Claims of Racism, Trump Points to His Black Friends
item.description: President Trump has often invoked his unnamed Black friends, or name-checked celebrities and athletes, when asked to discuss anything related to Black voters.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green and Dylan Freedman

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump speaking during an event for Black History Month at the White House on Wednesday. For Mr. Trump, talking about his loyal Black friends has long been a go-to tactic.

item.title: NJ Transit Will Suspend Service as Storm Disrupts Monday Commute
item.description: Other transit agencies, including the Long Island Rail Road and Metro-North, were adjusting their schedules starting Sunday evening because of the winter storm.
item.dc:creator: Johnny Diaz

media:content.media:credit: Andres Kudacki for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: An NJ Transit train arriving at Newark Penn Station last month. Several transit agencies in the New York City metropolitan area announced service changes or suspensions because of the storm.

item.title: 12 Unforgettable Looks at the BAFTAs: Kate Middleton, Prince William and More
item.description: Swishy suits, mermaid skirts, skunk feet and more.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television

media:content.media:credit: Isabel Infantes/Reuters
media:content.media:description: The Prince and Princess of Wales graced the British Academy of Film and Television Awards in coordinated formal wear.

item.title: Iran Students Protest for Second Day Despite State Crackdown
item.description: Student groups reported protests at universities in Iran’s two largest cities as the government grapples with domestic discontent and the threat of U.S. strikes.
item.dc:creator: Erika Solomon, Sanam Mahoozi and Devon Lum
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:description: A screen grab from a social media post that was verified by The New York Times showing demonstrators at the Tehran University of Art on Sunday.

item.title: El ejército colombiano enfrenta una nueva amenaza letal: drones baratos modificados
item.description: En Colombia, la rápida proliferación de drones armados cada vez más sofisticados entre los grupos insurgentes se ha convertido en un inmenso reto para el gobierno.
item.dc:creator: Max Bearak and Simón Posada

media:content.media:credit: Federico Rios para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Robinson Hernandez y John Silva, quienes trabajan para una empresa especializada en tecnología de drones y antidrones, utilizando dispositivos para neutralizar drones durante una prueba en Bogotá, Colombia.

item.title: Iran Could Direct Proxies to Attack U.S. Targets Abroad, Officials Warn
item.description: Security officials are monitoring increasingly worrisome signs as President Trump considers another military campaign against Iran.
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A new billboard in Tehran this month. The uncertainty surrounding possible threats from Iran’s proxy groups further complicates the Trump administration’s war planning.

item.title: The Case for Striking Iran
item.description: The Iranian people should not be let down again.
item.dc:creator: Bret Stephens

media:content.media:credit: Vahid Salemi/Associated Press

item.title: ‘The Waterfall’ Review: A Mother’s Blessing and a Daughter’s Burden
item.description: Phanésia Pharel’s wistful two-hander starring Patrice Johnson Chevannes and Natalie Paul looks at a Haitian American family and questions of legacy.
item.dc:creator: Rhoda Feng

item.title: New York City Public Schools Will Have a Snow Day on Monday
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said that no remote classes would be held. The last official snow day in the city’s schools was in March 2019.
item.dc:creator: Mihir Zaveri

media:content.media:credit: Stephen Speranza for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Children playing in Prospect Park in Brooklyn during a snow day in 2019. Mayor Zohran Mamdani announced on Sunday that schools would be fully closed on Monday, with no remote learning.

item.title: The February 2026 Northeast Winter Storm, in Maps and Charts
item.description: See where snowfall and cold temperatures are expected.
item.dc:creator: Aatish Bhatia, William B. Davis, Josh Katz and Bea Malsky

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Winter Storm Disrupts Travel at Major Airports in the Northeast
item.description: With significant snowfall and strong winds expected across the region, many flights were canceled. New York City’s airports were among the hardest hit.
item.dc:creator: Johnny Diaz

media:content.media:credit: Spencer Platt/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: At LaGuardia Airport in New York, nearly 40 percent of flights were canceled on Sunday.

item.title: ‘El Mencho’, líder del CJNG, fue abatido, dice el gobierno de México
item.description: Era el capo más buscado y uno de los más poderosos. El día que fue abatido grupos armados causaron incendios y bloqueos en distintas zonas del país.
item.dc:creator: Jack Nicas and Paulina Villegas

media:content.media:credit: Gilberto Gallo/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Agentes de policía aseguran una zona en la que miembros del crimen organizado incendiaron vehículos en Zapopan, México, el domingo.

item.title: Map: 7.1-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes the South China Sea
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
item.dc:creator: William B. Davis, Madison Dong, Judson Jones, John Keefe, Joey K. Lee and Bea Malsky

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Live Updates: Powerful Storm Hits Northeast With Heavy Snow and High Winds
item.description: More than 200,000 customers across the Mid-Atlantic had no power early Monday, and public-transit disruptions were snarling travel across the region.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
